Message.Msg: Why aren't other stocks splitting?

OK, then July 27th only represented a cut date for current holders to receive split plus additional shares. Then at end of Market day Aug 10th will represent the approx split price for Monday Aug 13th barring any after market movements. yes, i realize if I buy before Aug 10th i'll receive split, but, do not qualify for additionsl shares.

Message.Title: Stock split
Message.Msg: When is or was the stock split, and what are the details?

"OK, then July 27th only represented a cut date for current holders to receive split plus additional shares." There are no additional shares. One share splits into two; nothing more. Further, any shareholder of record who sells their shares before the ex-date of August 13th also sells their rights to the split. In cases where the ex-date is after the record & payment dates, the only relevance of the record date is to state that only shares outstanding as of that date participate in the split. It's very different from a normal distribution but those are the stock exchange rules every company has to follow. "i realize if I buy before Aug 10th i'll receive split, but, do not qualify for additionsl shares." Only because there are no additional shares. Anyone who was a shareholder of record on July 27th with the same number of shares as you and holds through the 10th will still have the same number of shares as you after the split. Where did you get the idea there will be additional shares beyond the split?
Great company, but lets face it, KO is WAY TOO EXPENSIVE. ALL stocks in the XLP are overpriced.

The problem is that we are seeing the beginnings of a major sector rotation out of "fear trade" names and into tech, commodities, consumer disc, risk on, etc. This could last years. KO is a great company but simply priced too high now.

I see some over bought situations temporarily, but, then, there are people that just need to park their money on a blue chip and get a dividend and sleep at night. So, this one is really buy on dips and keep on waiting for the uptrends to kick in.
BearPundit agrees with you: http://bearpundit.com/2012/08/07/overpriced-great-dividend-stocks-are-still-overpriced/

nonsense. Mighty KO traded in the mid nineties nearly 15 years ago when it was 50% smaller in revenues. i think we're seeing a super bull cycle which will take this to $100. What are you going to do, sell and buy a bunch of tech junk? no thanks.

It's all about valuation and growth, not emotions. You will get more for your money in AAPL, DECK, QCOR, CTSH, MA, GOOG, CLF, CMI, MOS, FFIV, BIDU, VRA, COH, too many to list. Look at FOSL today.Yes, there are far better values in tech, commodities, consumer disc.
BearPundit is right. Thanks for that link.
no addition share, my error.....mis read ko home page, just your basic split. sorry bout that.....

Message.Title: Sector rotation beginning
Message.Msg: "As Europe has calmed down, the U.S. market leadership has been inverting. In a month where the S&P is up 1.6 percent, defensive/dividend payers (telecoms, drug companies, utilities, and Real Estate Investment Trusts) have underperformed this month, while growth/cyclicals have outperformed." I'm warning everyone. Get out of defensive stocks now. http://finance.yahoo.com/news/most-hated-stock-rally-history-193228964.html
